body: We do specify a dependency, but possibly not in a way that easy_install picks up. Frankly, I don't think we should be accommodating easy_install - pip has been the recommended tool to use for years now.

FWIW, I also see this sort of issue with `pip`. It is also affecting me on Travis CI. Admittedly, this may be an upstream issue with `pip` as it seems to get, but not install `traitlets` in time. Here is the log from a local install below.

Sigh, executable install scripts are a pain. It's installing the necessary dependencies, but it's trying to install IPython before installing its dependencies.

Your version of pip is more than two years out of date - newer versions of pip prefer wheels, which don't suffer from this problem. So, start by doing:

```
pip install --upgrade pip
```

You're right. I am trying to figure out a way to reproduce this locally in a simpler manner, but I'm clearly not hitting the mark. Maybe it is just easier to show you what I am seeing. When trying to install `ipython`, it somehow doesn't get `traitlets` installed. I am using the 8.0.2 version of `pip` from `conda` here. This happens on multiple Python environments.

Here is the build log ( https://travis-ci.org/paulgb/runipy/jobs/106632660#L582-L727 )

FWIW 4.0.3  did not present this issue

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

@jakirkham the build is doing `setup.py install` - the official advice is to always do `pip install .` instead now. I know, it's stupid, but that's the way Python packaging goes.

@Carreau I think it's your changes to check the version number at build time that's causing this. We may need to back them out.

Ah, I see. What a mess indeed. So, I tried doing `pip install .`, but I had a different problem where it somehow doesn't install `runipy` as an egg while expecting to find one, but I think this has nothing to with `ipython`. Though maybe you know what is going on here.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/conda/bin/pip", line 6, in <module>
    sys.exit(pip.main())
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/__init__.py", line 230, in main
    return command.main(cmd_args)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/basecommand.py", line 246, in main
    pip_version_check(session)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/utils/outdated.py", line 102, in pip_version_check
    installed_version = get_installed_version("pip")
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/utils/__init__.py", line 817, in get_installed_version
    working_set = pkg_resources.WorkingSet()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 626, in __init__
    self.add_entry(entry)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 682, in add_entry

    if metadata.has_metadata('PKG-INFO'):
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1610, in has_metadata
    return self.egg_info and self._has(self._fn(self.egg_info, name))
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1968, in _has
    return zip_path in self.zipinfo or zip_path in self._index()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1848, in zipinfo
    return self._zip_manifests.load(self.loader.archive)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1788, in load
    mtime = os.stat(path).st_mtime
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/runipy-0.1.5+5.g1f1380e-py2.7.egg'
```

Running `pip install .` again not only works fine, but complains that `runipy` is installed correctly. Log snippet from the problem portion below.
That looks like some generic Python packaging fail. No idea what state it's managed to get itself into.

Figured it out. I had run `python setup.py install` so it got confused when running `pip install .` as there was some build cruft generated from the former that the latter didn't know what to do with. If I clean up this build cruft or start fresh, the problem resolves itself.
